title.narrative: Masculinities and Gender equality in Bolivia

description.narrative:
PROMUNDO "Maskulinitet och Jämställhet i Bolivia, 2017-2020, 10,2 MSEK"
Insatsen syftar till att anpassa, utföra och sprida resultat från International Men and Gender Equality Survey (IMAGES). Resultaten kommer att användas för att utveckla program- och policyrekommendationer för att bättre engagera män och pojkar för att uppnå kvinnors fulla ekonomiska, sociala och politiska jämlikhet och för att bidrag till att förebygga våld mot kvinnor. För att omvandla genomgripande könsskillnader i Bolivia är det nödvändigt att utveckla djupare forskning och förståelse för mäns attityder och övertygelser, liksom normer och beteenden, när det gäller jämställdhet. Vidare syftar projektet till att stärka lokala partners kapacitet för att genomföra ett effektivt arbete med män för jämställdhet. Programmet kommer att genomföras i tre överlappande faser: i) forskning, ii) kapacitets byggande tillsammans med metodutveckling och nätverks uppbyggande, iii) implementering (Program P)
PROMUNDO är en känd internationell organisation med många års erfarenhet av forskning om maskulinitet.
Insatsen bedöms bidra till hållbarhetsmål 5 Jämställdhet samt Bolivias Patriotiska Agenda. Vidare bedöms insatsen bidra till strategin för Sveriges utveklings samarbete med Bolivia 2016-2020, särskild resultatet "Stärk demokrati och jämställdhet samt ökad respekt för mänskliga rättigheter".

The initiative aims to adapt, perform and disseminate results from the International Men and Gender Equality Survey (IMAGES). The results will be used to develop program and policy recommendations to better engage men and boys to achieve women's full economic, social and political equality and to contribute to the prevention of violence against women. In order to transform radical gender differences in Bolivia, it is necessary to develop deeper research and understanding of men's attitudes and beliefs, as well as norms and behaviors in terms of gender equality. Furthermore, the project aims at strengthening local partners capacity to carry out effective work with men for gender equality. The program will be implemented in three overlapping phases: (i) research; (ii) capacity building along with method development and networking, iii) implementation (Program P)
PROMUNDO is a renowned international organization with many years of experience in research on masculinity.
The effort is expected to contribute to sustainability goals 5 Equality and Bolivia's Patriotic Agenda. Furthermore, the initiative is considered to contribute to the strategy for Sweden's development cooperation with Bolivia 2016-2020, the special result "Strengthening democracy and gender equality, and human rights."

The overall goal of the programme is: Adapt, carry out and disseminate the findings from the International Men and Gender Equality Survey (IMAGES) along with complementary qualitative research in Bolivia. The findings will be used to develop program and policy recommendations for better engaging men and boys in achieving women’s full economic, social and political empowerment and working to end violence against women. Outcomes by level of intervention: 1. Quantitative and qualitative research developed, implemented and analyzed in Bolivia 2.1. Local activists have developed relevant in-depth knowledge and critical skills and have been trained in successful gender justice programs that engage men and boys as partners and agents of change to promote gender equality, prevent GBV, and contribute to the care economy. 2.2 Activists form a national network of actors working on masculinities and/or fatherhood in Bolivia 3. Building the capacity of local partner(s) to scale up Program P

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: The narrative report presented is for the period January to December 2019, the results for this activity period are following: Phase 1:(IMAGES) Expected Outcome: Adapt, carry out, and disseminate thefindings from the International Men and Gender EqualitySurvey (IMAGES) along with complementary qualitativeresearch in Bolivia. Results from the reporting period: • Obtained Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval from the International Center for Researchon Women’s ethical board. • Solicited, underwent a procurement process, and hired additional in country supervision for datacollection and quality assurance • Conducted a 5-day long training of data collectors and a pilot testing of fieldwork procedures andmonitoring mechanisms • Completed all data collection for IMAGES survey component ~2,000 observations• Completed all initial analyses of IMAGES data • Conducted a data validation/consultation meeting in person with the Technical Advisory Group(TAG) for IMAGES Bolivia where we reviewed key results from the IMAGES survey andconsulted on possible framing and dissemination strategy• Conducted additional analyses of IMAGES data based on recommendations from the TAG consultation. Developing of the final product for presenting IMAGES survey data – a slide deck. • Design a concept for a complementary qualitative study to explore one dimension of theIMAGES Bolivia survey data – masculinities, violence and indigenous identities – and engagedSIDA and the TAG in refining and obtaining approval for this study. Phase 2:(BNTI) Expected outcome: Build capacity within civil society to integrate a masculinities lens to work on ending GBV. Results from the reporting period: • Completed First Course of BNTI in La Paz • Assigned mentors to each participant • Disbursed seed funding to participants to implement Commitments to Action • Selected dates and drafted curriculum for second course of the NTI • Conducted webinar on Program H methodology Phase 3:(GendertransformativeProgramming) Expected outcome: Implement gender transformativeprogramming in institutions and local youthorganizations to transform individual gender attitudesand build support for practicing more equitable genderbehaviors Results from the reporting period: Finished implementation rounds of Program P in El Alto, reaching over 600 men and womenover one year of implementation • Developed a partnership with local organizations, namely Colectivo Rebeldia in Santa Cruz andECAM in Tarija, to adapt and pilot Program H in their local contexts • Began to adapt the Program H manual in partnership with Colectivo Rebeldia and ECAM • Conducted a weeklong training of Program H in September of 2019 • Finished data collection on baseline and endline attitudes and behaviors of interest for finalevaluation report on Program P
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
